pos: noun or participle which takes the aux. verb suru
meanings: carrying in one's arms (a baby, pet, doll, etc.)

lessons.japanese: あの若夫婦は今でも親におんぶに抱っこだ。
lessons.english: That young couple are still tied to their parent's apron strings.

lessons.japanese: あの若夫婦は今でも親におんぶに抱っこだ。
lessons.english: That young couple are still tied to their parent's apron strings.

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けない。抱っこ。
lessons.english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.

lessons.japanese: トムはメアリーをお姫様抱っこしてほっぺにキスをした。
lessons.english: Tom picked Mary up the same way a man carries his new bride across the threshold and gave her a kiss on the cheek.

lessons.japanese: トムはメアリーをお姫様抱っこしてほっぺにキスをした。
lessons.english: Tom picked Mary up the same way a man carries his new bride across the threshold and gave her a kiss on the cheek.

lessons.japanese: パパ、もう歩けない。抱っこ。
lessons.english: Daddy, I can't walk any more. Carry me.
